item.title: About
item.description: I grew up in Colorado, moving to Pittsburgh to attend Carnegie Mellon University for my undergraduate degree, before moving to Baltimore to begin my graduate education at Johns Hopkins University. I spent a few years in Boston while working at Amazon, but was drawn back to the Chesapeake and am currently living in D.C. I spend a lot of my time biking around, occasionally taking pictures. While I do enjoy nature a lot, I am particularly into urban environments.

item.title: Publications
item.description: 2023 M. Maciejewski, J. Shi, S. Watanabe, S. Khudanpur. A Dilemma of Ground Truth in Noisy Speech Separation and an Approach to Lessen the Impact of Imperfect Training Data. Computer Speech & Language. 2023 2021 M. Maciejewski, Towards Single-Channel Speech Separation in Noise and Reverberation. PhD Dissertation, Johns Hopkins University. 2021 [pdf] M. Maciejewski, S. Watanabe, S. Khudanpur. Speaker Verification-Based Evaluation of Single-Channel Speech Separation. Interspeech. 2021 [ISCA] M. Maciejewski, J.
